result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant Christopher R. Leach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Count 8
Complete probation on counts 2, 4 and 6
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Pay restitution - to be determined
Comply with and complete any counseling, assessments, treatment and/or AODA requested by the Agent and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations
If complies - dismiss count 8
Non-compliance - entry of conviction and formal sentencing

elements

ADA Fassbender present.
Def. present.
Atty. William Ackell present.
Ct. #2 - NC plea
Ct. #4 - State moves to amend to misd. theft 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) - NC plea
Ct. #6 - State moves to amend to misd. theft 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) - NC plea
Ct. #8 - NC plea - placed into DPA status for 2 years.
Ct. #10 - D&RI
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #2, amended Ct. #4, amended Ct. #6.  Ct. #10 D&RI. Court will accept plea on Ct. #8, but will withhold finding of guilt and places matter into DPA status for 2 years consistent with the DPA written agreement.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by counsel.
RHT to be held open at this time.
Probation - SW - 2 years concurrent
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action + RHT surcharge when RHT is determined.
2.  pay RHT - TBD.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to participate in any other counseling deemed appropriate.
5.  def. to maintain FT employment.
6.  def. to have no contact (directly or indirectly) with Specialized Products.
7.  def. to serve 60 days co jail - court will stay all days and make available to his Agent upon application to the court.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Def. to meet w/P&P today.
